COP28 is getting closer but today I want to look back at a bit of work we started before the summer (a lifetime ago) at the UAE Climate Tech event. In the race to achieve net-zero emissions its clear that innovation is our ally. No single solution will lead us to net zero. It is a multifaceted challenge that demands a holistic approach, including policy changes, and changes to the way business and people operate. Yes, we cannot just innovate our way out of trouble, other changes need to be made and it is true that climate tech is just one piece of the puzzle, its significance cannot be understated. New technologies hold the power to revolutionize the way we mitigate and adapt to climate change. ¬∑ Climate tech fosters the development of clean energy sources, sustainable transportation, and energy-efficient infrastructure. These innovations are the engines driving our transition to a low-carbon world. ¬∑ Climate tech facilitates international cooperation, connecting innovators, investors, and governments to create a collective force against climate change. ¬∑ Data and analytics are the backbone of informed decision-making. Climate tech harnesses data to enhance climate modelling, disaster prediction, and resource allocation, empowering us to respond to climate events more effectively. ¬∑ Climate tech solutions, from circular economy innovations to precision agriculture, help minimize waste and maximize resource efficiency. ¬∑ And in a world where sceptics and climate deniers will happily point to the cost of net zero (without mentioning the cost of inaction) climate tech represents a booming industry, offering significant economic opportunities. By investing in these technologies, we not only address climate change but also foster job creation and economic growth. If you are interested in exploring how the United Arab Emirates (UAE) can play a pivotal role in the climate tech revolution, have a look at the link to the report in the ADSW post below. Or come to COP28, a terrifyingly close 38 days away. #COP28 #ClimateTech #NetZero #Sustainability #Innovation #ClimateAction

The United Nations Climate Change Conference will start tomorrow in Expo City Dubai! As per the United Nations, this international climate summit (COP28 UAE) will be one of the largest international gatherings in 2023, followed closely around the world. As the world's highest decision-making process on climate issues, it is expected to host over 70,000 delegates, including heads of state and world leaders, to (hopefully) build consensus and facilitate progress on climate action among 197 countries, the EU, and thousands of non-government organizations, companies, youth groups, and other stakeholders. And we are here too, putting the finishing touch ups and updates to our sustainability exhibition on site, ready for the grand opening tomorrow! #COP28UAE #UNclimatechangeconference #UnitedNations #climatechange #bellpratpartner #bellpratfamily #narrativeenvironments #scenography #design #exhibitiondesign #livecommunication #LiveCom #experientialmarketing #experiencedesign

Has there been enough discussion about COP28? In my opinion, no. Have we fully grasped every single aspect of what happened, its implications, opportunities, and so on? Again, no. This event doesn't promise to provide all the answers but aims to explain in simple terms what COP28 was and why its understanding and consequences should not be taken lightly. Take a look at the description below and check out the cool graphic I've created. If it piques your interest and sparks your curiosity, feel free to join in!

We're excited to announce that the #OceanPavilion will return to the UN's COP28 UAE, taking place in Dubai, United Arab Emirates from November 30-December 12. Now in its second year, the Ocean Pavilion brings many of the world‚Äôs leading ocean scientists, engineers, philanthropists, and policymakers together to highlight the crucial importance of the ocean in our search for climate solutions. Throughout the two-week conference, the pavilion will feature more than 80 events, meetings, and in-depth discussions that elaborate on a set of conference themes, including Rising Seas, Climate & the Living Ocean, and Blue Economy & Finance. ‚ÄúWe live on an ocean planet and the ocean is central to climate resilience and mitigation,‚Äù said Peter de Menocal, WHOI President and Director. ‚ÄúIn 2023, we experienced some of the greatest ocean and weather extremes ever recorded, underscoring the urgency of science-based decisions to protect people and the ocean ecosystems upon which we all rely. Accelerated scientific research and ocean observing innovation must lead the way to protect the health and future of our planet.‚Äù Learn more about the Ocean Pavilion: https://lnkd.in/e8zJa9fU
